newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sweden, Singapore navies in mine clearing drill.
newsitem.headline: Sweden, Singapore navies in mine clearing drill.

text.p: The Swedish and Singapore navies began on Monday their first annual joint mine clearing exercises in the island state, the two navies said in a statement.
The drills, called Lejon Singa, will run until December 10, the statement said.
"Lejon Singa provides the navies of Sweden and Singapore with the opportunity to work together in the area of MCM (mine counter measure) operations," it said.
Four ships from the Singapore navy will participate. Five Swedish navy officers and 120 Singaporean navy servicemen will take part. Sweden will host the exercises next year.
